## GAD-7 vs ITQ

Comparing essential psychological scales like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the International Trauma Questionnaire (ITQ) can be a cumbersome task. The need to harmonise these items and ascertain similarities and differences, considering they measure varying psychological criteria, is essential for researchers in psychology. This is where the 'Harmony' software lends a hand, making the process of comparing GAD-7 and ITQ both efficient and precise. 'Harmony' using advanced AI technology not only automates the process of harmonising questionnaire items across multiple languages but also assesses a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and ITQ. For instance, GAD-7 primarily focuses on symptoms of generalised anxiety, while the ITQ evaluates traumatic experiences. Using 'Harmony', researchers can effectively comprehend the overlapping and distinct aspects of these two scales, thereby eliminating the traditional, time-consuming, and subjective process. For any researcher or psychologist keen on understanding GAD-7 vs ITQ, 'Harmony' helps to make the most of the available longitudinal and cohort studies. By offering a comprehensive analysis of GAD-7 vs ITQ, 'Harmony' ensures the accuracy and efficiency of the research. Consequently, whether it's GAD-7, ITQ, or any other psychological scales, consider switching to 'Harmony' for a more streamlined, reliable, and consistent comparative analysis.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and ITQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and ITQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ITQ into Harmony</a> - compare ITQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
